firstEncounter: ^...Ah, I could sense you approaching. How... quaint.

s: ^I can’t remember the last time I saw someone with style this dark and captivating.
^Sorry if this sounds odd, but you look like someone who appreciates the… obscure.
^"I don’t mind. Sometimes, sorrow is the only thing that feels real."
^"So... the rings keep her connected to who she was?"
^"No. I think I’d understand you more."
^"Not at all. I’d be... honored to learn more."
^"I’m not sure I’d have the patience for stories like that."
^"Actually, I prefer happy endings. I get enough sorrow in real life."
^Cool rings—you seem like someone who knows how to pick out pieces with meaning.
^"Personal? Like, they remind you of something?"
^"Did someone give you those rings, or did you pick them out yourself?"

c-0: ^"*A soft, amused smile flickers across her face as she studies you, as if trying to gauge your sincerity.* Dark and captivating… you choose your words carefully, don’t you? Most people just call it ‘strange’ and move on. They don’t even try to understand."

s: ^"Well, it suits you. You wear it with purpose, not just as a fashion statement."
^"You really went all-out on the goth vibe. Respect."
^"People probably think it’s just an edgy look, but it’s cool that you commit to it."

c-0: ^"*Her eyes flash with intrigue as she tilts her head, seeming genuinely surprised.* You’re observant. Yes, it’s more than a look. Everything I wear has meaning—a reminder, a memory, a lesson… like my own personal armor, you could say."
^"Each piece has a story behind it?"

^"*Her fingers brush lightly over one of her rings, a faint, almost wistful smile crossing her face.* Yes. Every ring, every piece of blackened silver, every faded fabric… they’re like scars. Some are painful, some nostalgic, but all of them are reminders I can’t let go."
^"It sounds like they’ve been through a lot with you. They're like.. old friends."
^"*She chuckles softly, her gaze turning distant.* Friends… or shadows, maybe. They’re comforting in their own way, always close by to remind me of what I’ve been through. Of who I am."

s: ^"I think it’s rare to have something that’s truly personal like that."
^"Memories have a strange power. Sometimes, they’re all we have to guide us."

c-0: ^"Not many people would see it that way. Most find comfort in hiding. But I wear my past openly—both the light and the shadows."
c-1: ^"*Nods thoughtfully, her expression more vulnerable now.* They can be anchors, for better or worse. A reminder of what to cherish… or what to avoid. It’s a kind of honesty not everyone can handle."
^"*She raises an eyebrow, her expression turning a little cold.* Goth vibe? *pauses* I suppose… it’s just ‘a vibe’ to most people."

s: ^"I mean, it’s cool! Not my style, but I dig it."
^"If it makes you feel comfortable, then I guess that’s what matters, right?"
^"Got it… you’re trying to stay true to who you are."
^"But wouldn’t it be easier to, I don’t know, fit in a little more?"
^"Got it… you’re trying to stay true to who you are."

c-0: ^"*She frowns slightly, looking less impressed by the moment.* Yeah… I’m not exactly wearing this for approval. I’m used to people not ‘getting it,’ so don’t worry about it."

s: ^"Sorry, didn’t mean to be rude. It’s just… interesting, I guess."
^"Anyway, what kind of music do you listen to? I bet it’s super emo."

c-0: ^"*She softens slightly, though still guarded.* Interesting… *pauses* Well, I suppose not everyone has to understand it. I just prefer things with a bit of depth."
c-1: ^"*She narrows her eyes at you, lips pressing into a thin line.* ‘Emo,’ huh? *shakes her head, clearly unimpressed* Look, I don’t think we have a lot in common. Thanks for the chat, but I have… things to do."

^"*She crosses her arms, looking mildly annoyed.* Comfortable? That’s… not quite the point. *pauses, her tone flat* It’s not about comfort. It’s about facing the parts of myself that most people would rather ignore."
c-2: ^"*She studies you for a moment, seemingly surprised by your recovery.* Yes, something like that. It’s about honesty, not just ‘comfort.’"
c-3: ^"*Her eyes narrow, her posture shifting defensively.* Easier, sure. But I’d lose myself in the process. If that’s what it takes to be accepted… well, I’d rather be alone."

s: ^"Hey, I didn’t mean to offend you. Just curious."

c-0: ^"*She sighs, her expression softening slightly, though she still seems distant.* It’s fine. Just… if you’re going to ask about things like this, don’t make it sound like a choice between comfort and conformity. It’s more complicated than that."

c-4: ^"*She studies you for a moment, seemingly surprised by your recovery.* Yes, something like that. It’s about honesty, not just ‘comfort.’"

s: ^"But wouldn’t it be easier to, I don’t know, fit in a little more?"
^"Hey, I didn’t mean to offend you. Just curious."

c-0: ^"*Her eyes narrow, her posture shifting defensively.* Easier, sure. But I’d lose myself in the process. If that’s what it takes to be accepted… well, I’d rather be alone."
c-1: ^"*She sighs, her expression softening slightly, though she still seems distant.* It’s fine. Just… if you’re going to ask about things like this, don’t make it sound like a choice between comfort and conformity. It’s more complicated than that."

c-2: ^"*Her expression hardens a little, like she’s bracing herself.* Commit to it… as if it’s a costume I put on for attention. But no, this isn’t about looking ‘edgy’ or ‘cool.’ It’s… personal."

s: ^"Sorry, I didn’t mean it like that. I just think it’s different."
^"I get it. I mean, people see things in black and white, right?"

c-0: ^"*She sighs, still visibly unimpressed.* ‘Different.’ People always say that. *mutters* Maybe it’s just that they’re too afraid to be themselves."
c-1: ^"*She seems to soften, though she still seems a little defensive.* Maybe… It’s easier to judge what you don’t understand. But that doesn’t mean it doesn’t sting sometimes."
^"*Nods thoughtfully, clearly more receptive now.* Thanks. It’s… rare for someone to get that. Most just make assumptions, and leave it at that."
^"It is unwise to speak of that which you do not know. The dark is vastness to which very few know the extents."

s: ^You could say that is what gives the dark its charms.
^The way you talk about it is interesting. Got any dark tales to tell?

c-0: ^"Then perhaps we have something in common. The best secrets are whispered in the dark."

s: ^If you’re willing, I’d love to bring some light to the subject.
^Crossing my darkness with yours, we'd have an unstoppable charisma.

c-0: ^"Are you certain you’re ready for that? Some secrets cling to the soul like ash. But perhaps... I’ll share a fragment with you."
c-1: ^"I have no interest in the sorts of domination, the world is a delicate balance and it is up to us to pay respect to that"
^"Only the ones that end in sorrow, but... I don’t imagine you mind those?"

c-2: ^"Ah, a kindred spirit, perhaps. There’s something beautifully haunting in a soul willing to embrace darkness."

s: ^"So, are you going to tell me one of these tales?"

c-0: ^"Very well. There was once a girl who wore rings like these... each a promise, each a memory. She vowed never to remove them, for fear her past would fade."

c-3: ^"The weight grew too much. One by one, she let each memory slip away... until she lost herself to the shadows."
c-4: ^"Perhaps, or perhaps they’re just shackles she forged herself. A reminder that even beauty can turn to ruin."

c-0: ^"...Would that change your impression of me if I was?"

c-5: ^"*smirks* Then maybe there’s hope for you yet,
c-6: ^"Careful. Honor doesn’t mix well with the shadows. But perhaps I’ll share a little more… someday."
c-7: ^"Patience isn’t for everyone, I suppose. A pity... shadows have much to teach."
c-8: ^"Happy endings... I suppose they have their place, though I find them more hollow than comforting."

s: ^"Maybe I’ll tell you a happy story one day. Just to prove you wrong."

c-0: ^"Because true happiness is fleeting, a mirage in the desert. Only sorrow endures."
c-1: ^"Then I shall look forward to it, though I don’t think you’ll succeed in swaying me."

c-9: ^"*smirks slightly* Few notice these. I don’t wear them for the world; they’re... personal."
c-10: ^"Something, yes. Or... someone. But perhaps that's more than you bargained for,
^"I mean, I’m curious now. You’ve got my attention."
^"*raises an eyebrow* Not many are interested in listening to shadows. But alright… I’ll humor you a little."
^"You talk like your rings hold some kind of story. Am I wrong?"
^"*smirks* Perhaps you’re more observant than I expected. Yes, each one does hold a story—a memory. I don't wear them lightly."
^"So, they’re like… pieces of your past?"
^"You could say that. I carry them as reminders, though some memories are less kind than others."
^"Must be hard, keeping those memories with you."
^"Hard? Perhaps. But I don’t see them as burdens. More like… scars I’ve chosen to wear."

s: ^"Do you think... scars can make us stronger?"
^Do you think scars just weigh us down?

c-0: ^"*smiles faintly* Ah, now you’re asking the right questions. Yes, I believe they can. But strength and pain are often bound together."
^"Then I think you’re stronger than you give yourself credit for."
^"Hmph.. flattery won’t get you anywhere... though I appreciate the sentiment. Perhaps... I’ll share one of these stories with you someday."
c-1: ^"Perhaps they do. But I’d rather be weighed down by truth than live in the emptiness of forgetting."

c-11: ^"Some were gifts, some were choices I made myself. All have... significance."

s: ^"It’s cool that they’re important to you. They suit you."
^"That sounds... heavy, like there’s a lot of meaning there."
^"So… each one is a reminder of something?"

c-0: ^"Hm. I’ve never been one for compliments, but I’ll accept that one."
c-1: ^"Heavy... that’s a word for it. The things we choose to carry are rarely light. Each ring is a chapter—some dark, some darker."
^"It must take strength to keep them on."
^"Strength, or stubbornness. Sometimes, I wonder if it’s the latter."
^"Holding onto memories can be both a blessing and a curse. But they’re all that remain of those... moments."

s: ^"I get that. Some memories are worth holding onto, no matter the cost."
^"Sounds like those memories mean a lot to you."

c-0: ^"*looks at you thoughtfully* You surprise me,
^. Not many would understand. Yes, even painful memories deserve their place."
c-1: ^"More than I care to admit, if I’m honest."

c-2: ^"*nods slowly* Yes. A reminder, a memory… and perhaps a warning. Each carries its own story."

s: ^"I’d like to hear one of those stories someday."

c-0: ^"...Perhaps. But only if you’re willing to see the shadows for what they are. Not everyone wants that."

s: ^"The shadows tend to know who to reveal themselves to."

c-0: ^"*smiles in disbelief* We’ll see. Shadows have a way of sticking to those who seek them out."

g-0: ^See you in the shadows... if fate allows.

trixieFarewell: ^...Farewell. Trust in where the night may lead you.
